subject: Technology
title: The Streaming Wars: Everyone Wants a Piece
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Streaming Wars: Everyone Wants a Piece.

hook.text: Netflix created streaming. Then Disney, Apple, Amazon, and HBO all launched their own. It's cable TV all over again.

buildup.text: Studios pulled their content from Netflix to put on their own platforms. Friends left for HBO Max. The Office went to Peacock.

discovery.text: Subscribing to everything now costs more than cable did. The cord-cutting revolution came full circle.

twist.text: Most streaming services lose money. They spend billions on content hoping to outlast competitors until only a few survive.

climax.text: The market is consolidating. Smaller services merge or fold. The streaming wars will end with fewer, bigger winners.

punchline.text: We cut the cable cord. Then we needed six streaming subscriptions instead.

quiz.question: What ironic outcome has the streaming wars produced?
options: Subscribing to all services costs more than cable did
